definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: Sadly enough, the generator was all but forgotten during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 但不幸的是，这些机器在二战期间被完全遗忘废置。

sentences.english: Devices fall out of favor, but seldom if ever get abolished by design.
sentences.chinese: 设备被完全废置很少见，即使在设计上完全废弃。

sentences.english: It must have seemed the logical place to abandon the trains which were no longer needed.
sentences.chinese: 它似乎成了丢弃废置火车的理想之地。

sentences.english: API-cleaning by removing deprecated artefacts and minor changes.
sentences.chinese: 通过移除废置的工件和细微的变化整理了API。

sentences.english: These changes might be revised or reverted before going live.
sentences.chinese: 这些改动在上线之前都有可能被修改或是废置。

sentences.english: A fatal explosion at a plastics factory being dismantled in Nanjing is the latest in a series.
sentences.chinese: 日前，一间位于南京的废置塑胶厂发生爆炸。

definition: to abandon/to let go to waste
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
to set sth aside/to let sth lie idle/idle/unused
lit. abandoned by men and choked with weeds/desolate (idiom)
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to put to the torch (idiom)/to commit to the flames/to burn sth down deliberately
to fall into disuse (of laws, customs etc)/to neglect
